metadata.title: CVE-2017-9148 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The TLS session cache in FreeRADIUS 2.1.1 through 2.1.7, 3.0.x before3.0.14, 3.1.x before 2017-02-04, and 4.0.x before 2017-02-04 fails toreliably prevent resumption of an unauthenticated session, which allowsremote attackers (such as malicious 802.1X supplicants) to bypassauthentication via PEAP or TTLS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
freeradius-common - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
freeradius-iodbc - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
freeradius-krb5 - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
freeradius-ldap - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
freeradius-mysql - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
freeradius-postgresql - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
freeradius-utils - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
libfreeradius2 - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeradius package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.8+dfsg-0.1build2').
